A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The remake that was not a remake? The story has been told before but that does make it a bad thing\, - The Last Jedi uses a well worked formula\, one that was first told in 1977 when I was a young lad\, now I return with my teenage children and they were thrilled as I was all those years ago. For me\, there was some sadness to be reminded so visually that 40 years have flown by and that life itself is a circle\, - Luke that was once the student is now the teacher and we naturally favour the student waiting for them to out-perform the master as he (or she) fades away. \nVisually there is a lot to see in this film\, - it has taken the series to the next level and I wonder how they will match it next time\, - but thinking that is a sign of having just watched a great film\, the film that I have been waiting for since walking out of the cinema in 1977. Unfortunately there were a couple of editing gaffs which could plague a few fans with OCD\, but for me the next scene came around quickly so I moved on.\nThe final word\, - great to see a film that brings the family back to sharing the experience of the cinema.
